Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: suitecloud

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Outputs the version number

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: account:manageauth
Arguments.Description: Manages authentication IDs (authID) for all your projects. An authentication ID is a custom alias you gave to a specific account-role combination

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --info
Arguments.Description: Prints the following information for the specified authentication ID (authID): account ID, role ID, and url. Usage: account:manageauth --info {authID}

Arguments.Name: authID
Arguments.Description: authID

Arguments.Name: --list
Arguments.Description: Prints a list of all the configured authentication IDs (authID). Usage: account:manageauth --list

Arguments.Name: --remove
Arguments.Description: Removes an authentication ID (authID). Usage: account:manageauth --remove {authID}

Arguments.Name: authID
Arguments.Description: authID

Arguments.Name: --rename
Arguments.Description: Renames an authentication ID (authID). You must specify it together with the renameto option. Usage: account:manageauth --rename {authID} --renameto {newauthID}

Arguments.Name: authID
Arguments.Description: authID

Arguments.Name: --renameto
Arguments.Description: Specifies the new ID for an authentication ID (authID). You must specify it together with the rename option. Usage: account:manageauth --rename {authID} --renameto {newauthID}

Arguments.Name: authID
Arguments.Description: authID

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: account:savetoken
Arguments.Description: Saves a TBA token that you issued previously in NetSuite

Arguments.Name: --account
Arguments.Description: Specifies the ID of the account to log in to

Arguments.Name: id
Arguments.Description: id

Arguments.Name: --authid
Arguments.Description: References the custom name you gave to a specific account-role combination

Arguments.Name: auth id
Arguments.Description: auth id

Arguments.Name: --tokenid
Arguments.Description: Specifies the token ID of a TBA token you issued previously in NetSuite

Arguments.Name: token id
Arguments.Description: token id

Arguments.Name: --tokensecret
Arguments.Description: Specifies the token secret of a TBA token you issued previously in NetSuite

Arguments.Name: secret
Arguments.Description: secret

Arguments.Name: --url
Arguments.Description: Specifies the NetSuite domain of the account you want to use. You only need to specify the NetSuite domain if you are not using a production account

Arguments.Name: domain
Arguments.Description: domain

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: account:setup
Arguments.Description: Sets up an account to use with the SuiteCloud CLI for Node.js

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Specifies the NetSuite domain of the account you want to use. You only need to specify the NetSuite domain if you are not using a production account

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: file:create
Arguments.Description: Creates a SuiteScript file

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --module
Arguments.Description: Specifies the SuiteScript modules you want to add to the SuiteScript file. For example, "N/record"

Arguments.Name: module
Arguments.Description: module

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Specifies the File Cabinet path of the SuiteScript file to create. For example, "/SuiteScripts/ClientScipt.js"

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: path

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specifies the type of the SuiteScript file that you want to create. For example, "ClientScript"

Arguments.Name: type
Arguments.Description: type

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: file:import
Arguments.Description: Imports files from an account to your account customization project. You cannot import files from a SuiteApp

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Specifies the File Cabinet paths of the files to import. For example, "/SuiteScripts/file.js"

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: path

Arguments.Name: --calledfromcomparefiles
Arguments.Description: Message displayed should be different if called from Compare Files

Arguments.Name: --excludeproperties
Arguments.Description: Excludes all file properties within the .attributes folder

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: file:list
Arguments.Description: Lists the files in the File Cabinet of your account

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --folder
Arguments.Description: Specifies the File Cabinet path, for example, "/SuiteScripts". All files within subfolders are included

Arguments.Name: cabinet
Arguments.Description: cabinet

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: file:upload
Arguments.Description: Uploads files from your project to an account

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --paths
Arguments.Description: Specifies the file cabinet paths of the files to upload. To specify multiple paths, enter a space between paths and enclose the entire argument in double quotes. For example, "/SuiteScripts/file.js" for account customization projects, and "/SuiteApps/com.project.example/script.js" for SuiteApp projects

Arguments.Name: files
Arguments.Description: files

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: object:import
Arguments.Description: Imports custom objects from your NetSuite account to the SuiteCloud project. In account customization projects (ACP), if SuiteScript files are referenced in the custom objects you import, these files get imported by default

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --appid
Arguments.Description: Specifies your application ID. If specified, only custom objects with that application ID are imported. Otherwise, only custom objects with no application ID are imported

Arguments.Name: app id
Arguments.Description: app id

Arguments.Name: --destinationfolder
Arguments.Description: Specifies the project folder where objects will be stored. It must be within the Objects folder of your project. For example, /Objects/MyObjects

Arguments.Name: --excludefiles
Arguments.Description: Indicates that the SuiteScript files referenced in custom objects are not imported. It can only be used in account customization projects (ACP)

Arguments.Name: --scriptid
Arguments.Description: Specifies the script ID. To specify multiple IDs, enter the IDs separated by spaces. Enter "ALL" to import all custom objects of the specified type

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specifies the type of custom objects to import. Enter "ALL" to import all custom objects. To see what custom objects are supported by SDF, see https://system.netsuite.com/app/help/helpcenter.nl?fid=sdfxml.html

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: object:list
Arguments.Description: Lists the custom objects deployed in an account

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --appid
Arguments.Description: Specifies your application ID. If specified, only custom objects with that application ID are listed. Otherwise, only custom objects with no application ID are listed

Arguments.Name: app id
Arguments.Description: app id

Arguments.Name: --scriptid
Arguments.Description: Specifies the script ID. If you specify it, only objects containing that script ID will be listed. Otherwise, all objects are listed

Arguments.Name: script id
Arguments.Description: script id

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specifies the type of custom objects to list. To specify multiple types, enter the types separated by spaces. Otherwise, all types are listed. To see what custom objects are supported by SDF, see https://system.netsuite.com/app/help/helpcenter.nl?fid=sdfxml.html

Arguments.Name: types
Arguments.Description: types

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: object:update
Arguments.Description: Overwrites the custom objects in the project with the custom objects in an account

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --includeinstances
Arguments.Description: Includes instances. This is only available for custom records

Arguments.Name: --scriptid
Arguments.Description: Specifies the script ID of the objects you want to overwrite

Arguments.Name: script id
Arguments.Description: script id

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: project:adddependencies
Arguments.Description: Adds the missing dependencies to the manifest file

Arguments.Name: project:create
Arguments.Description: Creates a SuiteCloud project, either a SuiteApp or an account customization project (ACP)

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --overwrite
Arguments.Description: Overwrites the existing project

Arguments.Name: --projectid
Arguments.Description: Specifies the project ID. It is mandatory for SuiteApps

Arguments.Name: project id
Arguments.Description: project id

Arguments.Name: --projectname
Arguments.Description: Specifies the project name

Arguments.Name: name
Arguments.Description: name

Arguments.Name: --projectversion
Arguments.Description: Specifies the project version. It is mandatory for SuiteApps

Arguments.Name: project version
Arguments.Description: project version

Arguments.Name: --publisherid
Arguments.Description: Specifies the publisher ID. It is mandatory for SuiteApps

Arguments.Name: publisher id
Arguments.Description: publisher id

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specifies the project type. Enter one of the following options: ACCOUNTCUSTOMIZATION or SUITEAPP

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: project:deploy
Arguments.Description: Deploys the folder containing the project. The project folder is zipped before deployment, only including the files and folders referenced in the deploy.xml file

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --dryrun
Arguments.Description: Runs a preview of your deploy process. Your project is not deployed

Arguments.Name: --log
Arguments.Description: Sets the deployment log file location, as either a directory or a file name. If it is a directory, a default log file is generated in the specified location. If a log file already exists in the specified location, deployment log details are appended to that existing file

Arguments.Name: location
Arguments.Description: location

Arguments.Name: --validate
Arguments.Description: Validates the project before deploying. If an error ocurrs during the deployment, the process is stopped

Arguments.Name: --accountspecificvalues
Arguments.Description: Indicates how to handle the presence of account-specific values in an account customization project. If there are account-specific values in the project, enter WARNING to continue with the deployment process, or ERROR to stop it. If the option is not specified, the default value is ERROR. It only applies to account customization projects

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Applies the settings from the hiding.xml, locking.xml, and overwriting.xml files. It only applies to SuiteApps

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: project:package
Arguments.Description: Generates a ZIP file from your project, respecting the structure specified in the deploy.xml file

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command

Arguments.Name: project:validate
Arguments.Description: Validates the folder containing the SuiteCloud project

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Runs the command in interactive mode

Arguments.Name: --log
Arguments.Description: Sets the validation log file location, as either a directory or a file name. If it is a directory, a default log file is generated in the specified location. If a log file already exists in the specified location, validation log details are appended to that existing file

Arguments.Name: location
Arguments.Description: location

Arguments.Name: --server
Arguments.Description: Indicates that the server will perform the validation

Arguments.Name: --accountspecificvalues
Arguments.Description: Indicates how to handle the presence of account-specific values in an account customization project. If there are account-specific values in the project, enter WARNING to continue with the deployment process, or ERROR to stop it. If the option is not specified, the default value is ERROR. It only applies to account customization projects

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Applies the settings from the hiding.xml, locking.xml, and overwriting.xml files. It only applies to SuiteApps

Arguments.Name: -h
Arguments.Description: Displays help for the command
